_comment: Created by ianb on 08/06/2015 16:34:10 using v2.6
title: Has the percentage of women who smoke at birth decreased?
analysis_commentary: The percentage of women who smoke at the time of birth has been decreasing since 2004/05. In 2013/14, 12% of maternities had a women known to be a smoker; this is a decrease of 4.9% from 2004/05. The Department of Health's first integrated highly emotional smoking campaign was launched in 2003/04. The decrease in smokers we see here is also seen in similar data such as the NHS Stop Smoking data . Both of the decreases seen are linked with an increased government focus on reducing the number of people who smoke in England at this time.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, Women's Smoking Status at Time of Delivery
